param.para: The access mode to use when opening the file. Supported enumeration values are , , and .
When using , the object can be used to read all the existing data.
When using , points to a zero byte file. Existing data will be overwritten when the object is closed and the transaction is committed.

When using , the points to a file which has all the existing data in it. The handle is positioned at the beginning of the file. You can use one of the methods to move the handle position within the file to write or append new data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Describes the different SQL authentication methods that can be used by a client connecting to Azure SQL Database. For details, see Use Microsoft Entra Authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.NotSpecified
member.summary: The authentication method is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.SqlPassword
member.summary: The authentication method uses Sql Password. Use Sql Password to connect to a SQL Database using SQL Server authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryPassword
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Password. Use Active Directory Password to connect to a SQL Database using a Microsoft Entra principal name and password.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryIntegrated
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Integrated. Use Active Directory Integrated to connect to a SQL Database using integrated Windows authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryInteractive
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Interactive. Use Active Directory Interactive to connect to a SQL Database with an interactive authentication flow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryServicePrincipal
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Service Principal. Use Active Directory Service Principal to connect to a SQL Database using the client ID and secret of a service principal identity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryDeviceCodeFlow
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Device Code Flow. Use Active Directory Device Code Flow to connect to a SQL Database from devices and operating systems that do not provide a Web browser, using another device to perform interactive authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryManagedIdentity
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Managed Identity. Use System Assigned or User Assigned Managed Identity to connect to SQL Database from Azure client environments that have enabled support for Managed Identity. For User Assigned Managed Identity, 'User Id' or 'UID' is required to be set to the "client ID" of the user identity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryMSI
member.summary: Alias for "Active Directory Managed Identity" authentication method. Use System Assigned or User Assigned Managed Identity to connect to SQL Database from Azure client environments that have enabled support for Managed Identity. For User Assigned Managed Identity, 'User Id' or 'UID' is required to be set to the "client ID" of the user identity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryDefault
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Default. Use this mode to connect to a SQL Database using multiple non-interactive authentication methods tried sequentially to acquire an access token. This method does not fallback to the "Active Directory Interactive" authentication method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlAuthenticationMethod.ActiveDirectoryWorkloadIdentity
member.summary: The authentication method uses Active Directory Workload Identity. Use a federated User Assigned Managed Identity to connect to SQL Database from Azure client environments that have enabled support for Workload Identity. The 'User Id' or 'UID' is required to be set to the "client ID" of the user identity.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions
member.summary: Bitwise flag that specifies one or more options to use with an instance of .

summary.para: When specified, AllowEncryptedValueModifications enables bulk copying of encrypted data between tables or databases, without decrypting the data. Typically, an application would select data from encrypted columns from one table without decrypting the data (the app would connect to the database with the column encryption setting keyword set to disabled) and then would use this option to bulk insert the data, which is still encrypted.

Use caution when specifying AllowEncryptedValueModifications as this may lead to corrupting the database because the driver does not check if the data is indeed encrypted, or if it is correctly encrypted using the same encryption type, algorithm and key as the target column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.CheckConstraints
member.summary: Check constraints while data is being inserted. By default, constraints are not checked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.Default
member.summary: Use the default values for all options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.FireTriggers
member.summary: When specified, cause the server to fire the insert triggers for the rows being inserted into the database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.KeepIdentity
member.summary: Preserve source identity values. When not specified, identity values are assigned by the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.KeepNulls
member.summary: Preserve null values in the destination table regardless of the settings for default values. When not specified, null values are replaced by default values where applicable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.TableLock
member.summary: Obtain a bulk update lock for the duration of the bulk copy operation. When not specified, row locks are used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions.UseInternalTransaction
member.summary: When specified, each batch of the bulk-copy operation will occur within a transaction. If you indicate this option and also provide a object to the constructor, an occurs.

In some situations, can set incorrectly. If this occurs and is called, EndExecuteNonQuery could raise a SqlException error if the amount of time specified in elapsed and the asynchronous operation specified with is not complete. To correct this situation, you should either increase the value of CommandTimeout or reduce the work being done by the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.OpenAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: The cancellation instruction.
member.summary: An asynchronous version of , which opens a database connection with the property settings specified by the . The cancellation token can be used to request that the operation be abandoned before the connection timeout elapses. Exceptions will be propagated via the returned Task. If the connection timeout time elapses without successfully connecting, the returned Task will be marked as faulted with an Exception. The implementation returns a Task without blocking the calling thread for both pooled and non-pooled connections.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

exception.para: Calling more than once for the same instance before task completion.
A connection was not available from the connection pool before the connection time out elapsed.

member.exception: Any error returned by SQL Server that occurred while opening the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectRetryCount
member.summary: The number of reconnections attempted after identifying that there was an idle connection failure. This must be an integer between 0 and 255. The default value for non Azure endpoints is 1. For Azure SQL endpoints, the default is 2. Starting in version 5.x, for Azure SQL serverless or on demand endpoints, the default is 5 to improve connection success for connections to an idle or paused instance. Set to 0 to disable reconnecting on idle connection failures. An will be thrown if set to a value outside the allowed range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo
member.summary: This enumeration provides additional information about the different notifications that can be received by the dependency event handler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.AlreadyChanged
member.summary: The object already fired, and new commands cannot be added to it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Alter
member.summary: An underlying server object related to the query was modified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Delete
member.summary: Data was changed by a DELETE statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Drop
member.summary: An underlying object related to the query was dropped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Error
member.summary: An internal server error occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Expired
member.summary: The object has expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Insert
member.summary: Data was changed by an INSERT statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Invalid
member.summary: A statement was provided that cannot be notified (for example, an UPDATE statement).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Isolation
member.summary: The statement was executed under an isolation mode that was not valid (for example, Snapshot).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Merge
member.summary: Used to distinguish the server-side cause for a query notification firing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Options
member.summary: The SET options were not set appropriately at subscription time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.PreviousFire
member.summary: A previous statement has caused query notifications to fire under the current transaction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Query
member.summary: A SELECT statement that cannot be notified or was provided.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Resource
member.summary: Fires as a result of server resource pressure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Restart
member.summary: The server was restarted (notifications are sent during restart.).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.TemplateLimit
member.summary: The subscribing query causes the number of templates on one of the target tables to exceed the maximum allowable limit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Truncate
member.summary: One or more tables were truncated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the info option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Update
member.summary: Data was changed by an UPDATE statement.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource
member.summary: Indicates the source of the notification received by the dependency event handler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Client
member.summary: A client-initiated notification occurred, such as a client-side time-out or as a result of attempting to add a command to a dependency that has already fired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Data
member.summary: Data has changed; for example, an INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, or TRUNCATE operation occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Database
member.summary: The database state changed; for example, the database related to the query was dropped or detached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Environment
member.summary: The run-time environment was not compatible with notifications; for example, the isolation level was set to snapshot, or one or more SET options are not compatible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Execution
member.summary: A run-time error occurred during execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Object
member.summary: A database object changed; for example, an underlying object related to the query was dropped or modified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Owner
member.summary: Internal only; not intended to be used in your code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Statement
member.summary: The Transact-SQL statement is not valid for notifications; for example, a SELECT statement that could not be notified or a non-SELECT statement was executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.System
member.summary: A system-related event occurred. For example, there was an internal error, the server was restarted, or resource pressure caused the invalidation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Timeout
member.summary: The subscription time-out expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the source option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType
member.summary: Describes the different notification types that can be received by an event handler through the parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Change

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Subscribe

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the type option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

summary.para: A relative ranking of the sensitivity of a query or of a column that is part of per column data.
It is an identifier based on a predefined set of values which define sensitivity rank. Used by other services like Advanced Threat Protection to detect anomalies based on their rank.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.NOT_DEFINED
member.summary: No sensitivity rank defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.NONE
member.summary: Corresponds to rank value of 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.LOW
member.summary: Corresponds to rank value of 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.MEDIUM
member.summary: Corresponds to rank value 20.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.HIGH
member.summary: Corresponds to rank value 30.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.DataClassification.SensitivityRank.CRITICAL
member.summary: Corresponds to rank value 40.
